intro: Catapodium gracile, commonly known as the slender catapodium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its fine, linear leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, demonstrating a high degree of drought tolerance. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize disturbed or sandy soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in restoration projects in dryland ecosystems.
